HediffDef.label: full of vitamines
HediffDef.description: Vitamins are essential nutrients that the body needs to function properly. They help the body to convert food into energy, build and repair cells, and fight off infection.

HediffDef.label: lack of vitamines
HediffDef.description: Lack of vitamins can have a number of negative effects on the body, including slow wound healing, decreased ability to convert food into energy, and decreased ability to fight off infections.

HediffDef.label: full of proteins
HediffDef.description: Getting enough proteins is important for maintaining muscle mass, building new cells, and repairing damaged cells.

HediffDef.label: lack of proteins
HediffDef.description: Lack of proteins can have many negative effects on the body. It can lead to weakness, slow wound healing and increased risk of infections.

HediffDef.label: full of carbohydrates
HediffDef.description: Carbohydrates are an important source of energy for the human body. They are broken down into glucose, which is the body's main source of energy. Glucose is used by the brain, muscles, and other organs to function properly.

HediffDef.label: lack of carbohydrates
HediffDef.description: Lack of carbohydrates can lead to a number of health problems, including fatigue, irritability, confusion
